title: ConversationAlign
text: ConversationAlign R package analyzing alignment interlocutors (conversation partners) engaged dyads (two partner conversations). ConversationAlign work one natural language transcripts following file types: txt (text files) csv (comma separated values) otter.ai transcripts saved txt files two people conversing

title: ConversationAlign
text: ConversationAlign transforms raw language data simultaneous time series objects spanning 40 possible dimensions (affective, lexical, semantic). ’s overview package transforms language time series data computing alignment indices overview ConversationAlign

title: ConversationAlign
text: Install development version ConversationAlign GitHub entering following console script:

title: ConversationAlign
text: ConversationAlign work txt csv files. can handle Otter.ai formmated files, can also handle home brew preferred format long transcript least two columns (order transcript matter). first (header) row transcript must designate interlocutor (person producing output) text. prepping raw transcripts, careful mark columns follows using one options. order columns matter: 1) Interlocutor, Speaker, Participant 2) Text, Utterance, Turn conversation dyad saved separate file (e.g., MaryJoe_FirstDateTalk.txt). important ConversationAlign read data R, append document IDs, split dyad separate list. ConversationAlign runs many operations dyad ultimately binds data summary dataframe. ConversationAlign marks conversation unique event_id populated filename (deliberate naming!). metadata (e.g., age, timestamps, grouping variables) language transcripts retained. Move raw transcripts folder. default folder name ConversationAlign search machine ‘my_transcripts’. However, want specify folder name ’s fine . call path argument first function called read_dyads().

title: ConversationAlign
text: function read files concatenate single dataframe, appending document IDs. can call dataframe whatever like. read_dyads default reading csv txt files folder called my_transcripts. Just remember finished processing set transcripts, make sure move folder. can think ‘my_transcripts’ staging area loading data ConversationAlign.
code: MyRawLangSamples <- read_dyads() #if you want to specify a different folder, supply your own path MyRawLangSamples <- read_dyads("/my_custompath")

title: ConversationAlign
text: ‘clean_dyads’ uses regular expressions clean format data. function also omits stopwords using custom stopword list, lemmatizes (converts words dictionary entries) unless tell (lemmatize=T default). Run ‘clean_dyads’ object just assembled running ‘read_dyads’ function last step.
code: MyCleanLangSamples <- clean_dyads(MyRawLangSamples) #default is lemmatize=T #If you do NOT want your language sample lemmatized, change the lemmatize argument to F MyCleanLangSamples <- clean_dyads(MyRawLangSamples, lemmatize=F)

title: ConversationAlign
text: lot magic happens. align_dyads take cleaned dataframe created last step yoke values every word indexing lookup database. database populated published word norms numermous sources (e.g., afffectvec, Kuperman norms, Brysbaert norms, etc.). Yokes data word structures dataframe speaker exchange across dyad. prompted select one variables yoke data used later steps compute alignment indices. choices: anger, anxiety, boredom, closeness, confusion, dominance, doubt, empathy, encouragement, excitement, guilt, happiness, hope, hostility, politeness, sadness, stress, surprise, trust, valence, age acquisition, word length (letters), morphemes per turn, prevalence (many people know word), number word senses (polysemy), word frequency (lg10), arousal, concreteness, semantic diversity, semantic neighbors Run align_dyads cleaned dyads created last function.

title: align_dyads — align_dyads
text: Yokes user-specified semantic, affective, phonological values word cleaned language transcript. Prepares dataframe aligned exchange turn across Participant_IDs.
